intro: Anemopaegma acutifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in dry conditions. The flowers are usually small and yellow, appearing in clusters that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
